body:
```
$ python3.9 -m venv __venv__
$ . __venv__/bin/activate
$ pip install -e .
$ pip install xmlschema hypothesis
$ pytest -r s testing --maxfail 2
============================= test session starts ==============================
platform linux -- Python 3.9.0a2, pytest-5.3.3.dev36+g26a2e1aba, py-1.8.1, pluggy-0.13.1
rootdir: .../pytest, inifile: tox.ini, testpaths: testing
plugins: hypothesis-5.1.0
collected 2637 items

...
testing/code/test_source.py ...........FF

=================================== FAILURES ===================================
_______________________________ test_isparseable _______________________________

    def test_isparseable() -> None:
>       assert Source("hello").isparseable()

.../pytest/testing/code/test_source.py:125: 
_ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ 

self = <_pytest._code.source.Source object at 0x7f260e2130a0>, deindent = True

    def isparseable(self, deindent: bool = True) -> bool:
        """ return True if source is parseable, heuristically
            deindenting it by default.
        """
>       from parser import suite as syntax_checker
E       DeprecationWarning: The parser module is deprecated and will be removed in future versions of Python

.../pytest/src/_pytest/_code/source.py:143: DeprecationWarning
__________________________ TestAccesses.test_getrange __________________________

self = <test_source.TestAccesses object at 0x7f260d90da60>

    def test_getrange(self) -> None:
        x = self.source[0:2]
>       assert x.isparseable()

.../pytest/testing/code/test_source.py:146: 
_ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ 

self = <_pytest._code.source.Source object at 0x7f260d4d7e20>, deindent = True

    def isparseable(self, deindent: bool = True) -> bool:
        """ return True if source is parseable, heuristically
            deindenting it by default.
        """
>       from parser import suite as syntax_checker
E       DeprecationWarning: The parser module is deprecated and will be removed in future versions of Python

.../pytest/src/_pytest/_code/source.py:143: DeprecationWarning
=========================== short test summary info ============================
...
!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! stopping after 2 failures !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
=================== 2 failed, 606 passed, 7 skipped in 3.76s ===================
$ pip freeze
attrs==19.3.0
elementpath==1.3.3
hypothesis==5.1.0
more-itertools==8.0.2
packaging==19.2
pluggy==0.13.1
py==1.8.1
pyparsing==2.4.6
-e git+git@github.com:pytest-dev/pytest.git@26a2e1aba7d9e157b4537bbeb24ad372e8f8b919#egg=pytest
six==1.13.0
sortedcontainers==2.1.0
wcwidth==0.1.8
xmlschema==1.0.18
```

This workarounds the issue:

```patch
diff --git a/tox.ini b/tox.ini
index d33a62224..388b41d5b 100644
--- a/tox.ini
+++ b/tox.ini
@@ -168,6 +168,8 @@ filterwarnings =
     default:invalid escape sequence:DeprecationWarning
     # ignore use of unregistered marks, because we use many to test the implementation
     ignore::_pytest.warning_types.PytestUnknownMarkWarning
+    # https://github.com/pytest-dev/pytest/issues/6404
+    ignore:.*The parser module is deprecated.*:DeprecationWarning
 pytester_example_dir = testing/example_scripts
 markers =
     # dummy markers for testing
```

issue.title: Remove unused _pytest.code.Source.isparseable function

repository.name: pytest
repository.description: The pytest framework makes it easy to write small tests, yet scales to support complex functional testing

issue.body:
Besides unused, it uses the (deprecated in Python 3.9) parser module

Fix #6404

body:
Thanks @hugovk!

The replacement would be `ast.parse`, but I noticed `isparseable` isn't even used so I just removed it in #6405. üëç
Thank You! I would probably just spend time porting it to ast.
Indeed it was trivial (I did it before wondering if it was used), it was just a matter of replacing `parser.suite` by `ast.parse` basically.

Would you accept a backport of that to the 4.6-maintenance branch, once merged to master, or should we carry [the workaround](https://github.com/pytest-dev/pytest/issues/6404#issuecomment-570903345) until we switch to 5 (that should hopefully happen before Python 3.10)?

> Would you accept a backport of that to the 4.6-maintenance branc

Sure! üëç
Backport: https://github.com/pytest-dev/pytest/pull/6406 (went ahead and did it myself)

issue.title: Remove usage of parser module (deprecated in Python 3.9)

repository.name: pytest
repository.description: The pytest framework makes it easy to write small tests, yet scales to support complex functional testing

body: Sure, thanks again for the report üëç
